籤詩版本二:
Priceless jade and treasure hidden in stone
Just look for foreigners from other places
Just like holding a lamp to look for fire
It's better to clean up the wasted effort
詩意: This hexagram holds the lamp and looks for the symbol of fire. Everything will be accomplished in due time.
解曰: Marriage meeting. Nothing can be done. Must be unlimited. It's true before my eyes.
籤詩故事一:
◇Pang Juan observes the formation
During the Warring States Period, Sun Bin was a native of Qi. Pang Juan was a native of Wei. He also worshiped Gui Guzi as his teacher.
Sun Bin learned better than Pang Juan, and Pang Juan became the general of Wei. He fought with Sun Bin in a battle of wits, and when he lost, he hated Sun Bin.
He used a trick to cut off Sun Bin's feet. Later, Sun Bin pretended to be crazy and was able to escape.
King Wei of Qi used Sun Bin as his military advisor to lead troops to attack Wei.
Pang Juan went to Sun Bin's camp to inspect the military formation. Sun Bin deceived Pang Juan by pretending to reduce his troops and secretly adding more troops. Pang Juan pursued him to Maling Road and was shot to death by an ambush soldier with a crossbow.
(The metaphor of this story is that you are also talented, so why should you be jealous of his talent?)
聖意:

Peace of mind.

Marriage.
